laboratory_examinations.findings: Right eye 20/50 with eyeglasses, left eye 20/20. Subsequent measurements showed right eye 20/60 + 1 and improved to 20/40, then 20/13 after surgery.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Visual acuity in the right eye decreased from 20/50 to 20/60 + 1 over several days and then improved to 20/13 post-surgery.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Both pupils were 4 mm in diameter; relative afferent pupillary defect noted in the right eye.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: A relative afferent pupillary defect was observed in the right eye, which resolved after surgery.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Intraocular pressure was 16 mm Hg in the right eye and 17 mm Hg in the left eye at one point, later showed 17 mm Hg in both eyes.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: No significant changes over time specified.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Normal in the left eye; right eye showed a diffusely decreased visual field with relative sparing superonasal.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Right eye showed improvement in visual fields after surgery.

laboratory_examinations.findings: No evidence of a mass lesion or enhancement in the optic nerves; showed opacification of the left sphenoid sinus and mucosal thickening.
Complete opacification of paranasal sinuses with expansion and erosion along the optic nerve canals; findings consistent with allergic fungal sinusitis.
